reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is for the current version of the game(2/1/16)
What is Scrap Mechanic? Scrap Mechanic is a 3d sandbox where you can construct all kinds of things. From spider mechs to transforming houses, the things you can make are surprisingly vast considering how early in development this game is. The best part? They are planning to add plenty more, which will open up your options to even greater extents.

Positives:
This game has a pleasing aesthetic.
There's no limit to how complex/big your creation can be.
You can set up your vehicle to have multiple passengers, or co-pilots"(Useful for aircrafts and mechs).
You can automate things. (Spinning windmill
recommended:
etc)
The game actually has pretty good physics for the most part.
Decent variety of materials to use.
Quick load times.
Drop in/drop out multiplayer works flawlessly.
You can make games within this game! Like what me and my friend did in this video.
This game doesn't take a lot to run
hoursPlayed:
has pretty low minimum requirements for a 2016 game.
A survival mode is planned for the game.
Devs seem to be fairly active on the forums
There's 2 maps
voteText: one with terrain and one flat-world for those who just want to build.\nYou can create
helpfulPercent: (auto)save
votesHelpful:
and load back into multiple worlds.
There are in-game tutorials to help you out; they are well designed and easy to understand.
Negatives:
The game can lag pretty bad

votesFunny:
but plenty big enough to have fun in.

Sometimes you'll run into weird bugs while building more complicated things.
Intense rubberbanding can occur after long playtimes on multiplayer
When in a semi-fast vehicle

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is like a toast...

Your first attempt at toast looks pretty good, but you end up burning it.
You don't give up, after several attempts you make some better toasts
Those toasts taste awful and one nearly burns your entire house down
Desperate for toasting glory you search for some toast videos on youtube
All these people making enoromous and gloriously looking toasts make you jealous and sad
One day, you discover that you sorta don't need to make overcomplicated toasts to enjoy your snack. You also notice tiny differences between toasts and their preparation
You finally enjoy a proper toast, but the more you eat, the hungrier you get
Your hunger for toasts gets bigger and bigger with every known recipe
You start modifying your snacks and try challenges from other toast fans
You achieve toasting heaven, nothing can stop you now, you have mastered the art of toast. You begin preparing your masterpiece.
After several hours of hard work you end up burning it.
You look back at all your progres, and you realize that you don't have to make every toast perfect. It's in the dedication, will to learn from your mistakes and enjoying little victories on long and hard path.

This game is sweet combination of pride, joy and relief you'll feel after every successful mission although you also get hours of excrutiating pain, swearing and mental breakdowns. Get this game for full price, it's worth every penny.

...and I like toasts.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played about 20 hours so far and this early access is off to a great start

Scrap Mechanics allow me to create cars, houses, and engineering things like elevators, escalators, etc.

Pros:

- Allows me to make anything
- Make it as big or as small as you want
- Enough parts for me to play with as an early access game
- Multiplayer

Cons:

- It can get laggy if you place too many things (I heard there will be an update for that)
- Theres no undo or ctrl-z, so if you accidently delete something you could break it
- You can't move specific parts without having to delete it and then make another one in different spot (ex: Move engine from the back to the front or more the button up a bit)

Suggestions for the dev:

- Be able to run a community multiplayer server for people to join
- Add a wireless remote control
- Be able to create your own world with custom terrain, weather, rock/trees, hill/mountains, etc.

Overall I do see a great potential for this game to grow in near future with new parts, maps, and survival mode. I recommend this game to anyone that likes creativity with a little bit of engineering :).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't write many game reviews, but I felt it was necessary to write one for Scrap Mechanic. So here's the basic rundown of the game in my mind and in this review I will be listing items that I think should be addressed.

My Experience So Far So far on this game at the time of writing this review I have almost 16.5 hours played. As far as Early Access games go, this one is by far the most advanced from Launch Date that i've ever
seen on Steam, from Launch it had more than enough to keep you busy for hours on end right out of the gates, not very many games can say that. I started off watching the Videos on the game's
page like the Introducing ones that showcased the Controller, Thruster etc etc, then as I experimented and numerous trial and error situations, I started getting better and better at knowing
what was going on and how things click. I started with a little piddly concrete car with a horendous design, but then I started to get more intricate with my designs, using pipes and I-Beams
to make an overall badass design, then I found out the steering mechanics and how to work the controller with ease, once all this clicked I made some of my best creations.

Multiplayer As fun as this game is when you're alone, I thought to myself, Wow
date: this would be so fun if I had some buds to play this game with." Sure enough this game was already equipped with a\nMultiplayer from Launch! At first that seems amazing
recommended: but then once you start getting a total of 4 players and even sometimes 2 players

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game presents the most fun I've had in a while, and it's still in early development.

Pros:
-Place barrings, blocks, thrusters, wheels, seats, and more to create cool machines.
-Intuitive wiring system.
-Online Multiplayer possible.
-Overall amazing game.

Cons:
-No welding tool, so if you break a machine in half, you have to completely rebuild the other half.
-Occasional FPS drops with the lowest graphics settings (Keep in mind I play on a 1.3 Ghz processor.
-Noticable memory leaks after playing for two long.

Overall:
9/10 amazing game!  I can't wait for survival mode!

Suggestions:
-Welding tool (or other useful mechanism for the same purpose)
-Air resistance (to create lift for planes rather than upward thrusters)
-Water, submarine/boat parts, and water physics
-Randomly generated maps
-Optimization for less lag

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Scrap Mechanic is a sand box/ open world builder game that allows you to be an engineer or an architect, with your own transforming buildings and vehicles that you can fly and drive.If you like experimenting with mechanical design, and making things go from just spare parts, then Scrap Mechanic is sure to hook you instantly. But, if you are mechanically challenged don’t worry. The Devs at Axolot Games have put together a fun assortment of “smart” parts that are pre-wired to have your designs rolling, spinning, sliding, or flying in one direction or another… or every direction at once. It also provides a user handbook in your hotbar, complete with video how-to links. The building mechanics are simple and allow you to build walls and parts to scale with ease. But, expect a learning curve and a lot of laughs as you find yourself hanging upside down from trees.

Graphics/ Music:
The art is incredibly well done. The landscape is covered with a realistic style of comic book trees, rocks, and farm equipment. Music is not only upbeat, but a radio is provided and can be attached to creations on the go. But, there is no water anywhere. This would be a feature that would be highly desired, as it would allow for design of boats. In the current early access state, the graphics run a bit slow. The lag is real… especially on low-end machines. This is a factor that needs more work, and from what the devs are saying in the forum and frequent dev blogs, it is a priority. They’ve doubled their team size this month, and while they are still adding new features constantly, they are also busy improving existing features in the program.  I’ve noticed the game runs faster on my pc already in just the couple of weeks I’ve been playing. Other early access games I’ve played started out with similar lag, but were soon running with ease for me.

Narrative:
The survival mode story has you playing the role of a robot maintenance mechanic in space. You crash land on your first assignment on an agricultural planet where you are supposed to keep the ag-bots in working order. But, you find the place deserted and a couple of old vehicles that you can commandeer as is, or salvage for scrap parts for your own creations. This should provide more options for those players like me who have a hard time getting started with their first build.

However, the current build has you playing in creative mode only. You can choose the terrain map, which has rolling hills and steep valleys. This seems designed much like the Disney Cars playset in Disney Infinity 1.0, (sorry, but Steam isn’t the only platform out there) very fun, lots of room to drive and do stunts, and a variety of land features. Or you can choose a flat world with nothing but dirt, for experimenting with designs or hosting mp competitions.

Combat:
There seems to be no combat in the game at all at the moment. I haven’t found any indication of plans in this area either. The character takes no fall damage, and is not affected by hunger. Sunshine and noon are static for the time being. I assume the pending “survival mode” will include dynamic weather, and a day/night cycle, as well as other needs.  I also hope vehicular combat will be an option.

Multiplayer:
You are able to invite friends into your game with ease. This seems to be functioning well. I also discovered that you can go into the flat sandbox, set limits on the number of parts each player is allowed to use on their vehicle, and host a design competition with friends. This provides infinite options for hours of mp fun, as well as the ability to design your own world and even race tracks.

Pros:
•	Creative, fun, and highly playable as is
•	Wide array of simple usable parts to build almost anything you can imagine
•	Flight, Mechanics, & Construction
•	Encourages trial & error
•	Suitable for all ages (even adult engineer types)
•	High replay value

Cons:
•	Lag
•	No water, and limited map size in early access
•	No day/night cycle yet, creative mode only in current build
•	No combat yet

Scrap Mechanic is one of those games that I love to recommend, because it has everything to offer. It is family friendly, creative, and fun all at the same time. It is definitely an upper tier game and worth the price, because it has tremendous replay-ability. I rate it an 8 out of 10 in the sandbox/ open world builder genre, but will probably change that rating after the final release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game unleashes your creativity.

At first I made a simple car, then another, then a plane and a house. I eventually made a box that turned into a car.

Let yourself go wild, the physics will keep you in line.

Although it is early access, so there are a few bugs, it seems to run fine.

Pros

+Lots of pieces to fit together
+good physics
+good animations
+A book with a few starter projects

Cons

-some bugs (to be expected in early access)
-you can accidently erase part of your creation (maybe there should be a way to lock it in once you are done)

I would give it a 9 out of 10 for an early access game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok, here's my opinion on Scrap Mechanic;

Absolutely amazing, Scrap Mechanic is the sandbox I have forever been looking for, we already have infinite possibilities and the game isn't even finished. With survival mode coming out soon, the game will feel quite realistic, hunting for stuff and eventually getting mechanics and other bits and bobs to help us evolve our base and gear.

I don't see why people are having problems with this game, my PC is decent, but not the best out there, and it gets a solid 60-70 FPS at all times.

Summary;

Scrap Mechanic is great, it's a growing game with regular updates, yes it's a little glitchy but that's what you should expect when buying an early access game.

Overall, this game deserves a solid

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game when only 3 reviews were up after it launched in early access, but the preview and description made it sound like a really good open world online creation game.  Now after recording and editing my first video of this game, it's already got about 50 postive reviews, only a few hours after launching!  For a game I'd never heard of before tonight, I'd say that's pretty impressive!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nW8lq6GH18E

This game is super fluid and makes getting online and making some awesome machines really easy, yet with believable and realistic physics and mechanical functionality.  That means that not only is creativity rewarded with a game like this, but it will also reward well planned and constructed designs and attention to detail.  I love games like this.

If you ever played Besiege and wanted a game like that which also allowed you to play with your friends online in an open and free world, you'd found your dream I think!  Scrap Mechanic is going to make a lot of creative minds really, really happy and reward them with a great world and tools for building some truly amazing machines that only imaginations can think up.

Super friendly user interface, great instructions and tutorial is available but not required before jumping in and getting your hands dirty!  Love it, love it, love it!  ..And this is launch day in early access... just imagine what all else this game might deliver to gamers before it's all finished and complete!  ...Wow!

If you love legos, especially the Technics Legos... if you love the Besiege game... if you love open crafting worlds that allow your imagination to soar and also allow you to connect online with your friends.. this game is already a MUST-BUY in my opinion!

A++, fantastic job to the developers behind this amazing new early access game.  This is exacty why so many people buy early access games, and this is what more developers should try and strive for before releasing their new games into early access.

[Game provided by Developer]

The Value of Potential -or- A Quick Disclaimer
My imagination runs wild... seriously, I should have a harness for it. Sometimes it would be nice to have the ability, with a quick snap of the wrist, to yank it right back into reality. The understanding that I have a tendency to dream bigger than the possibilities (or even intended scope) of a game is a good thing... but there is a responsibility to others that goes beyond the value of simply understanding one aspect of who I am.

Please, do not purchase any game based on mine (or anyone else's) excitement for a game's potential, which is often the only kind of feedback you get from most of us. Understand there are many variables at play including disposable income, personal preferences, things that can change down the road (or things that don't change), and more. I suggest asking yourself... would you be okay spending the money if you only played it for an hour or less? If not, I recommend learning more about the game (any game) before making a decision.

Ok, sorry about the detour there, but with that said...

I'm Enjoying It
What's here I'm enjoying. I found myself at work today excited to get home and play it some more. In my first video for the game, I essentially introduce it to my viewers and explain what I am excited about. Since then, I have learned how to really use the Controller and am even more excited about the possibilities.

I've found myself thinking of so many things I want to do that I have begun to write them out. It's amazing to see the videos of what people are doing, but it really is something else when you have an idea and you make it happen. Watching all of the moving parts snap to position smoothly (after experimenting for a while)... it's great! I find myself clicking the buttons again and again... lemme see it one more time!

It's Accessible
Scrap Mechanic has found a way to present to you mechanisms that allow for great depths of creativity while simultaneously finding a way to present it to you in a way that is very approachable - easy to grasp. You may not be aware immediately of just how deep you might take it, but getting those basics down is really quite easy. It's an accomplishment that, I hope (and assume) speaks to the core of the goals of the development team. These are the kinds of things that help me imagine the game could have a very bright future. Accessibility is key.

My Only Concern" is What Is Not Here (Yet)
There is no survival mode yet. Watch some of the developer videos
date: or read the description of the game and you know it is coming in some form
recommended: but from what I have gathered (and I could have missed something somewhere) all we know is that our "farmbots" have gone crazy and our only hope for survival is to use our "quick thinking"
hoursPlayed: "creativity" and our "knack of turning your surroundings to your advantage". I have not seen anything about elements such as hunger
voteText: thirst
helpfulPercent: environmental hazards
votesHelpful: or anything else.\n\nSurvival mode is not only required
votesTotal: but it must also have some teeth in order to keep my interest for months and potentially years to come. Based on what I have seen so far
votesFunny: I have every hope and expectation that they CAN deliver on this (and I am SO very excited to see it in action!)

it's simply a HOPE of mine that it will be every bit as exciting and enjoyable as the other side of the game has been.

Final Thoughts
In it's current form

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay video + first impressions below:

https://youtu.be/r9BXmIBrG-4

Now I'll admit I have a soft spot for these games that give you basic blocks with set functions and see what crazy ♥♥♥♥ you can come up with. A car, boat, helicopter, automatic stairs, automated farms you name it.
Scrap Machanic is seriously scratching that itch for me. I start messing around with a simple idea and before long I've got 9 machines round me that all look different, none of them work and half are just jumping up and down against a tree. Then eventually one will shiny through, a brief moment of function springs to life. It all seems so simple at this stage but theres that instant moment of triumph. I find it never lasts though, it's not enough. Now I can build that I can biuld it bigger and better and now I'll work in this other feature. Its a neverending cycle for me. A sliding door one day and transforming pot plant the next.
Loving this game and probably will be for some time.
Runs like a dream and everything looks so beautiful in motion. Cannot wait for future updates to see what new blocks get added.
Highly recommended if you enjoy experiementing and creating.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun game, but not yet.

Sadly I keep falling into early access traps the day they come out. I guess I should say they aren't traps, but I do often get caught by the Look at these cool features" list and wanna play the game bad. I'm also a sucker for engineering and physics games
date: so this one similar to Space Engineers but simpler really caught my attention. Needless to say it needs work and many more additions to the game before it's worth the  buy. If you want to support the devs
recommended:
by all means do so since these guys have a real gem on their hands.

Now for the actual review.

Graphics: For the style of the game
hoursPlayed:
top notch graphics. Zero complaints and runs smooth as a butter.

Controls: Easily the best sandbox world controls I've ever player. Every button is where you think it should be. Not once did I ever think of switching a control. Definitely shows these devs are true gamers and know how hands work on a keyboard. More than I can say about most engineering game controls and simplicity.

Replay Value: Once they have more object in
voteText: I'd say it has the replay value of Minecraft. Most games like this have 150-200 assets to be used in game
helpfulPercent: this one has like 25. So pretty much after you've used the small amount of blocks and decoration blocks you're left with your imagination. However
votesHelpful: you are limited and a lot of the joy comes from that limitation and trying to find a way in game to work around what you want to do. For example
votesTotal: they have only one real tool that you program

commentsCount: meaning if you want a linear straight line  for something like a sliding door

This in no way takes away from the game as it allows you to explore what you have in front of you. Eventually things will be added to avoid these work arounds so people can play more efficiently without wasting 45 mins on a single sliding door.\n\nGameplay: This game feels fairly polished in terms of how everything works
column17: surprising since this is an Early Access game. By polish I don't mean everything works
column18: but everything feels like it works. UI makes sense and looks final
column20: world objects like trees and grass are all animated and look great
column25: etc. Everything in the game at the moement feels very good for how early on it is.\n\nOverall: The game is solid. A definite buy

reviewText:
Early Access Review

so i've been playing this game for a little while and i can say that i have enjoyed it. there are so many vehicles and houses you can create and it adds a challange at its current state. you can only use rotors to make moving parts and these rotors can be connected to a variety of different things. useing this base knowledge, you can create complex systems of moving parts that can perform in unison to create a very eye pleasing display of mechanical crafting at work. it is TRULY a splender to see your creation working and it's worth every hour that i, myself, have wasted building away.

now, real quick i want to lay in on the cons of this game as of now:
1- you can only play creative mode. this isn't really that bad, altho i do wish there was more of an objective. this game might be going twards a besiged setting for its survival or campain but i would like to see it like Banjo Kazooie nuts and bolts. yes i know that game was well hated for it's inconsistinces along with the others in the franchise but it had a great idea; build vehicles to complete challenges. this isn't a good thing for a survival setting, but they might want to consider a challage mode.
2- building is limited. this is a bit of a big one to me. i will usualy play for a little bit, make a huge build and then realize that i dont have building matterials that look very fluent with the build. either it be big and bulky or just not the right material you wanted. it's frustrating, but i know that the game is only early access so i try not to make a big deal. the matterials are good but it needs variety and more fluent parts. i would especially like it if you added some parts that i will list below if the devolopers read my wonderful review.
3- how big you can build is determind by how well your computer can perform. i do not have this issue but i know that this game is very strainuous on some lower end systems. they are in the middle of fixing this probablem so i will just move on.
4- there isn't much background music. if your like me, you will find this one a little upsetting. they have great music that plays when you start the game and sometimes while you play. i'm not including the radio music because it isn't considered actuall background as it is a device that plays music in the background. whenever i hear the music in the beggining, i feel like im in a oasis and it makes me a little bit relaxed. but when you start, the music fades out and all you hear is static from what i guess is the wind blowing through the grass. {nice touch by the way}

those were some cons. i don't really feel like sitting here and typing all the details so those just were the ones that were major.
Pros:
1- you get to build anything. from a house, to a car, to a jet, to a jet ski on land... it's all there for you to build. along with moving parts you can make magnificcent houses and vehicles at the cost of a nights sleep and half of your social life. building is limited but it's still good to try to build nice things with what you got.
2- you get to choose between male a female. altho its not a charactor creation system, it is nice to play as the opposite gender sometimes. or all the time-cough, cough, fallout and elder scrolls cough, cough-. its a nice touch that, altho doesnt give you any bonuses just yet in the game, allows you to have a different perspective on what you are going to build.
3- the world has charactor. when i first played i imediatly explored the entire map, including the flat map. i wanted to see if it was 100% flat. i was astonished to see a cartooned style world that had color and multiple areas that were all different in a uniqe way. instead of seeing the same lands over and over again, it kinda clashes them all together in a very uniqe way that you would have to play in order to understand.
4- it's multiplayer. i said it in my 7days review and i will briefly mention it here. friends bring more out of a game, period. single player will only get you so far but if you had even just one friend, thats where you start to have fun.
5- it's not a dead game. obviously, but i do want to mention that even though i did b--ch in the begging, you have to keep in mind that this game has alot of support and a team that candeliver constant updates.

basing on pros and cons and my experiance while playing the game i give it a headshot in my book

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fantastic building game. It's like Besiege meets Minecraft.
It has a lot of potential. Only sad part is devs are ignoring technical questions and most customers. Stability has gone done drastically and back up and there hasn't been an update that added any gameplay features. Sure music heads and paint are fun, but they don't allow you to build anything that you couldn't before and they obviously gave those priority to sell more copies.

So while I really, really want this game to become better and better, I have no idea what this game will look like in 6 months. Especially since they are not sharing any info on what direction this game is taking. Only thing we know is there's something about harvest robots and it will get a Survival mode, but they don't tell us anything really. They also don't acknowledge most technical problems until they are fixed, despite dozens of reports.

So I have very mixed feelings about this. I will be playing this for 100's of hours to come in Creative mode, so for me it's worth the 20 euro's. But objectively speaking... Paying 20 euro's for a game without support, no interesting updates in the first 2 months while not knowing where this game is going?

I love the game, but I kind of don't want to support how the developers are doing this, because I strongly dislike the turn the game industry is taking. But I still want you to buy it though, because I want this community to grow and it's the only game like this. So yeah just know what you're getting and the gamble you're taking.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game!

To sum it up, it would be Garrys Mod, combined with Minecraft.
The ease of building in Minecraft, with the mechanical aspect and graphics of Garrys mod.

This game is a steal for 19.99 and I highly recommend it.

Pros:
Easy building
Multiplayer
Fairly vast inventory for early access
Fun, intuitive mechanical building
Great Menu and Options interface
Comes with a in game instruction menu

Cons:
Movement is strange, almost feels laggy
The lift is annoying (Purely Personal Con)


What I would like to see:
Although it is cliche, some sort of explosive. The idea of making a hovercraft that can launch missles is very appealing.
Improved movement, I've notice that you almost slide for a short bit after moving. Making it annoying to line yourself up in the correct position.

All in all though, Scrap Mechanic is a great game. And I cannot wait until the updates roll in with new blocks and fixes.

EDIT: ♥♥♥♥ Andy72184, seriously.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOwning just about all of the physics-based bulding games on Steam, I can honestly say this has been one of the best purchases I've made of ANY game. Many will make comparisons to other games and while those games have their own strengths, in terms of just the foundation for physics-based building, this game surpasses them. Games like Garry's Mod, Space Engineers, and Besiege all have more stuff"
date: but they've also been around longer. The core of this game just gets everything right: the block building mechanic is intuitive
recommended: the physics are very well done
voteText:
and it already has multiplayer out of the gate.

-You like Gmod? This game has better physics and the bare bones beginnings of it's own version of Wiremod.
-You like Space Engineers? This game has a more intuitive building mechanic and you're not limited to the scope of space exploration.
-You like Besiege? This has multiplayer

Plus
helpfulPercent: this game will have survival in the future on top of parts and features that will be added.\n\nBottom line

SCORE
8.5/10 - and only because I demand more options out of building games having spent 3.5k in Gmod alone. This score will probably go up as the weeks and months go by."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, Scrap Mechanic..

For another entry into the building genre, its got a solid start. The things you can already achieve with a bearing, controller, button, switch, and sensor is quite awesome. You'll find yourself building a vehicle one way, just to find out you could do it better like this, wait... it would be better like THIS!...

Five hours later..

Now, there are some cons. Too many bearings will destroy your framerate. Destroy it. I've got a top-of-the-line PC and this thing wrecks it if get into more than forty bearings or so in an area... which... is unfortunate. So much for large builds, atm. This is an early access, but I would think it would be able to handle more.

All in all, very solid buy. Get it. You're already on this page, that means you think you might like it or already are into the genre. Do it now. You won't be sorry.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Amazing Game with incredible game mechanics and dynamics. Best builder I've played so far.

Could do with a support page of some kind for active users to give suggestions to developers on the fly as they discover something that could be improved upon in these early stages of development. Unless there already is something like this that I'm unaware of. a feature like this where direct communication with developers feel almost essential before a final release of a game with this much potential.

Very excited about the survival/story mode and the possibilities there-in.

the art style is impeccable and a great choice for this type of game feels good to step out of the hyper realistic feels of most building sims or the far too unrealistic ones and jump into something that is complex enough to keep your mind busy but simple enough to just start building incredible or hilarious constructs.

A little bit concerned about map sizes (feel they're a little too small) and lag caused by scene clutter or too many builds per scene. I encountered some performance issues (I have a reasonable PC running a GTX 980 ti) when I had a minimal base with folding doors and windows and 3 complex vehicle builds. In a building game you want to be able to show off a gallery of designs and models.

With that said two major features missing so far is the ability to eliminate an entire construct (instead of one piece at a time) and an undo function where eliminating one little block could inevitably ruin an entire design that took hours to build.

Having a community Workshop for this would be amazing to upload and share your creations with others and visa versa.

Despite my negative points I have massive love for this game and feel that anyone who loves a good building sim would too.

8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review might change in the future, but for now it's this.

While at first it looks promising and it does deliver a few things to tinker with, it's still quite barebones.
My review is kind of biased, since I'm getting tired of all these 'sandbox' games, that feel more like tools the developer made to create the actual game, but never did. As of writing the review, the game version is 0.1.11, which means that it has a long road to go, until it gets to the complete version. It might get faster after it's up on steam, but at this point it's believing on the promises the devs made, and I already have trust issues with most early access titles in the past, that seemed really promising, but did not go in the way I thought they would.
See, the problem is, I see this as a promising game, but when it gets to thinking about the future of it, it can go many ways, and only a few make me want to play it. There are a lot of questions that the game does not answer. And we are not talking about the creative mode, we are talking about the other gamemodes, that will actually make the game challenging.

Will it be more like Factorio, where you make automated factories for extracting resources, or do I have to grind everything like Minecraft?
Are most of the stuff cosmetic, or would they have an actual use? The electricity panel, the pipes, etc.
Would my car run out of fuel, so I'll have to extract fuel to make it run?

Is it going to get more in-depth, or is it going to get more content to work with? I prefer the former, since I'm already tired of all the games that provide the second. Can you promise me that? No.

For example, I saw 'Multiplayer', and when you first hear multiplayer, you are thinking about a server list to join in. Nope, you make a world and invite your friends to play with. I personally am not fan of that kind of 'multiplayer'. I want to join and do stuff with random players, not convince my friends to buy the game, so I have to play it, in a specific hour, and a certain period of time. I don't want to be dependent on that, I want randoms that go around in circles and do stupid stuff, so I don't feel like the last person on the planet.
Will it improve? Probably. Can you promise me that? No.

The game currently doesn't give me any info on how is it going to be developed further. Sure, I can ask the developers, but there are two factors - Player feedback, and realization. If most of the players want more content, and it gets more content, then I paid for a game other people want, not me. Then it's the realization, I might speculate all day how it's going to be done, but in the end, they are going to do it their way.

So, should you buy it? Depends.
Do you want minecraft meets GMod? Yes.
Do you want in-depth resource management, and complex contraptions that go beyond a house-car transformer? Wait, and see how it goes.

In the end, we've gotten to a stage where 'Early Access' titles are not even in Beta, nor Alpha, but merely Prototypes of the actual game.

Basic controls. Check.
Core mechanics. Check.
Map to explore. Check.

And by reaffirming the devs with all the positive reviews, and that it looks 'promising', you are going to see a lot of future titles, that are no more than prototypes that look 'promising'.
Castle story also looked 'promising'.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game and very addictive. Well worth the money for the amount of time you will spend playing this. Lots of different blocks/parts to use to create almost anything you could imagine. Let your creativity go crazy. Building rockets and robots is always fun. Has everything that i wished minecraft had. This game has replaced minecraft for me. Very keen to see how the game develops as they add more objects to the game.

Looking forward to the survival" mode where the farm bots etc are involved.

Only problem i have come across is sometimes you can accidentally make a run away rocket/car. If you accidentally delete the drivers seat depending on how you have setup the activation for the thrusters or engine it can run away on you. If you are lucky it will get stuck in a tree and you can retrieve it using the lift to capture it
date: other times it is gone for good such as in the case of a run away rocket dissaprearing into the sky. This can be funny as you try to chase your runaway creation but othertimes it can be frustrating if you have spent a long time perfecting it. Lesson learnt though
recommended: dont delete the drivers seat unlesss its attached to the lift.\n\nTheres some interesting features that make the engineering side of things more realistic. Such as needing to consider weight vs power. For example one thruster may be able to launch a small craft
hoursPlayed:
while if you build something heavy out of steel blocks then it will not and you will either need more thrusters or to reduce the weight. I have also noticed this happening with bearings used for moving parts such as doors etc. If it is a big heavy door made of steel blocks the single bearing may not have the power to lift it. Your options are then to create some sort of assistive mechanism or to recude the weight by replacing some steel blocks with something such as the medium weight beams or the light weight wooden blocks.

The weight balance can also affect your creations in other ways too. For example having lots of heavy blocks at the front of a flying craft and not much weight in the rear will cause it to nose dive. These little details mean you need to think more about balancing things out or adding counter weights.

All these extra features are not immediately apparent
voteText: and while the game can be simple
helpfulPercent: if you choose to optimise your creations then it can actually be quite deep thanks to these extra physics elements. Since there are ways to optimise your vehicles it would be nice to have a speedometer perhaps as part of the HUD when you enter a drivers seat so that there is a more measurable way to see what difference you may be making. eg. If you were trying to make the fastest car possible."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Besides the minor bugs and the lack of content, for an early access game it is so polished, beautiful and fun.

If you love sandbox games like Minecraft, Space Engineers, Infinifactory or any advanced sandbox game that isn't trash, then you would love this game.

Few bugs if the developers stumble upon this and for those wondering: Has problems saving (Please add a save button somewhere), The ragdoll has quite a few glitchy effects, When you load in some of your creations will float in the air, The game randomly crashed and didn't give me a bug report or anything, closing the game is really slow.


Pros/cons

Pros
- Quality Sandbox game
- Still very entertaining even without much content (countless possiblities and creations)
- Very well done textures and shaders
- Very polished and smooth

Cons
- Many minor bugs
- Early access (developers could end up ditching the game, BUT I have a feeling they won't, you can tell they love this game.
- Not sure if decently optimized for toasters or lower end pcs (never looked into the graphic settings... didn't need to)
- The biggest issue for me is there is no save button or way of telling when it auto saves, that needs attention.


I highly recommend either buying it if you want it or waiting for a sale because either way it will be worth it if you loved Banjo Kazooie Nuts & Bolts as much as I did.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game was a wonderful surprise. Give credit to the developers, the promo vids say it all.

Poured 15 hours into it. A huge amount of fun. The constructions people will make will be truly incredible. It boggles the mind when you realise after a few hours tinkering what could be possible, and the FUN you could have with friends. It forces you to think - sometimes you’ll just sit staring at your object as your brain melts - but at the same time is rewarding just to strap a few boosters on a chair to see what happens.

I've spent hours alone on buildings and rooms, let alone the vehicles. If you like the graphic style there's enough content to build a great looking workshop, warehouse or cabin in the woods. And basically enough mechanics to turn your house into a walking robot, if you have the time, skill and patience.

Currently with creative mode only, you make up your own goals. The ambitious or creative mind of a mechanic is spoilt here. You realise the value of suspension, tune the engine, figure it might go faster with boosters, then make it fly, then balance the weight, make it float with sensors, then add a co-pilot, laughing the whole time at the disasters, then you watch a YouTube video and realise you've barely scratched the surface: You could literally create a flying warship with a manned bridge!
Not that there’s any war yet.
Please can there be war?!

And you look back at the bizarre creations you’ve cluttered the world with, with both fondness and failure. Occasionally stumbling over one that went rogue.

At the core of it, for me at least, it’s the construction mechanics that make it great. Whilst not perfect, the build controls are still slick, fast and intuitive. Much more than I initially realised. It pays you to get to grips with them fast.

Multiplayer has worked well (for me at least). My girlfriend kept building milk floats, so I secretly turned the roof of our house into a rocket platform and invited her up there to press the button. No falling damage implemented yet, but still, for some reason, the funniest thing I've witnessed this year. And now we have a twinkling star up there in the atmosphere, constantly reminding me that I need to build a flying craft capable of getting out roof back.

As for PROBLEMS:
- Ran smooth enough for 10 hours till I experienced the odd crash. That could be down to me now building a mega structure, so maybe I'm pushing it a little. Quick crash, quick restart, saves every few seconds as far as I can tell. Annoying but not a problem.
- Get some odd ground vehicle movement in some areas of the map. It might be my design, but I think more likely the world bugging out slightly. Slightly annoying but not a problem.
- Occasional bit of slow down or stuttering.
- CPU running a little hot. I have an above average machine.
- Cannot keymap certain keys. ALWAYS frustrating for me as I hate using WASD. AutoHotkey sorted that out so all good.
- Lots of stuff needs tweaking, obviously.

Overall pretty damn solid for an EA game, and I feel like I’ve had my monies worth already!
Those that aren’t having the same experience as me I would imagine £15 a little steep. But I guess we take these risks on EA. Especially day 1.
£10 might be a fairer price, but I will happily pay a little extra to support the devs. That is after all what you’re doing when you hit the Purchase button.

Devs, please keep this up! I know you know we know you’ve got a gem here. Polish it!!!
And give me missiles!

Random tip: When working on a huge structure, use the vehicle lift as a motorised scaffolding. Put it under a light floor and jump on. Bit easier to reach high places!

EDIT: 50 hours in. Multiplayer experience is amazing with friends (connection through Steam is seamless) AS LONG AS it runs well on your system. We all need fair machines to play it due to lack of optimization.
The biggest problem is the frame drop when certain physics take hold. Basically big, heavy structures. Especially when they are resting on servos or suspension. You can have a HUGE amount of creative, collaborative fun, but don't think too big just yet...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you like to make more complex contraptions? This is the game for you
DO YOU LIKE TO MAKE UNNEEDLY COMPLEX MACHINES This is the game for you

While I only have played for less than two hours as of writing this, I have made two things, a secret door concept while  worked pretty well. Testing out how bearings worked and moved about. The other is a large scale bridge that can fold up and be expanded when needed, a draw bridge turned compact I'd say.

Pros:
Lots of possiblites at the current stage
Creative mode to learn and play with
Tutorials are a simple book that explains what everything does fairly well

cons:
No way to save manually
No way undo
Bit pricey


Tl;TR Its a fun game about making machines, rather fleshed out for alpha. Would recommend when on sale

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a game with a massive potential. I pretty much lost touch with gaming over the past years, but Scrap Mechanic kept me from working too much since its launch. I'm now forcing myself to postpone playing it in my free time :)

Early Access Release 1 Pro's:
- Enough blocks/parts to tinker with.
- Great atmosphere
- Multiplayer works effortlessly
- Light game engine. Runs maxed out at 2560x1440 on a medium rig.

Constructive criticism:
- Sometimes you get massive frame drops due to unoptimised physics.
- No center-point thrusters
- No small thrusters
- No way to rotate your lift, which sometimes forces me to run all the way back to the other side of the map with my vehicle to test it out in the only direction it points at.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello!
I have almost never played this type of game before, but I was poking around Steam and happened upon this and the concept struck me as interesting, so I took the plunge.
I eventually got round to installing, launched the game...flickering screen...
Basically, I think the game and my screen set up clashed ( I run 2k resolution scaling) and the game started out the box in 'border less windowed'. Took me a minute to find the cursor and change the resolution to full screen, but it fixed it.
Not a great start... But it is Beta.
Anyway, a quick squint at the controls, created a map, tried to read the manual...but (although it is good), just wanted to get building, so launched into it....3 hours later...I'm hooked!
I found the controls quite intuitive, the graphics looked good, the sound is very calming and the sound effects are wonderful, I think.
The physics are....interesting....for example, if you remove a supporting structure to a beam, it will predictably crash down to the ground....but when you build a massive vehicle made of steel and concrete the drive it over a bump, I found it reacted a little like a space buggy.
Could have been my building at fault to be fair.
The multiplayer functionality sounds very interesting , although I have yet to try this.
For a beta that's been out for just about a month, I give it 10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

REVIEW:
Very entertaining game.  Build anything you can think of and animate it. build and travel, Air & land.
Looking forward to the addition of more props and mechanics. Cant wait for PISTONS, dont know why we don't have them already.

Entertainment value for the dollar is excellant. I have spent more on other games that were much, much less enjoyable.

I would rate it 4 out of 5 STARS as it is right now in early access.  Very fun, many hours played so.

WANTS:
A few things I really wish for that were in the game.
(1.) an UNDO function and/or a WELDING tool, for those accidental deleting of critical parts/blocks.
(2.) Creation save feature/folder which would allow you to save any item you have on your LIFT to spawn more copies and/or take with you to friends maps.
(3.) Option(s) to have blocks be destructable for combat games. shooting a target and such.
(4.) More props, BALLS would be sweet in various sizes. 3x3, 5x5, 7x7? Items that are on map and not in prop pallet like SILOS and Billboards, Trees and Rocks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Is it worth it?
I have put 11 hours in the game so far and just bought it.

Positives
1. You can build anything you want.
2. There is multiplayer
3. There is lots of building tools even for a alpha
4. The games looks are nice to look at
5. There is alot of replay value
6.There will be a survival mode added some time soon
7. You can play as a male for female
8. There is a first and thirdperson with a FOV slider.
9. The game can play on most computers (Im just using a little laptop not made for gaming and i get decent frames My settings are on low of course though)

Now on to the negitives

1. Atleast for me everytime i exit the server the game crashes and i lose about 5 mins of progress
2. If you are playing multiplayer the server will lag a small bit
3. Players in your game can destroy what you built i would understand a sorta raiding system in survival but not one in creative.
4. With every early access game you dont know if it will be finished
5. The game does bug out at times.
6. No names over peoples heads in multiplayer.

Final verdict a 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As soon as I saw this game, I knew I'd have to have it. It's early access, but you still have unlimited potential. You might be thinking, right off the bat, that twenty whole dollars is a lot for an early access. Usually, I'd agree, they should be 10 bucks or 15 bucks at most, but for the open-endedness of Scrap Mechanic, 20 is pretty fair.

First off, for those of you that are on the edge:
If you like Besiege,
If you like Minecraft,
If you like any sort of in-depth construction game,Then Scrap Mechanic is your game!

I don't really do it justice because you have to experience it, but there's a super-active community growing around it that definitely have videos and such up on the community page for you to check out.

I'll give you some pros and cons regardless.

PROS:-Super fun
-Endless possibilites
-You can make music
-Good multiplayer (and it's only early access!)

CONS:-Infrequent, somewhat small updates*
-Requires pretty decent hardware, especially on multiplayer and with huge/mobile structures**
-It's really hard to be creative on creative for me.

*I could be out of the loop though, might be a huge update in the works.
**I have a GTX660 so it might just be me.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nthis review is for the developers (devs for short). the game is absolutly amazing to be an early release game. and i cant wait to see the official release of the game. feew personal thoughts i want to ask you guys though. you have lights in the game but they cant be connected to anything nor do they auto maticly turn n. will you be comming out with a day/night cycle and the lights actually turn on them selfs or no? and my second questional thought is the game itself. its good really good but the game is called scrap mechanic and im thinking your building your own stuff kind of like a mechanic but nothing in the game breaks down or anything. will you guys be comming out with something that will will make it more realistic like engine break downs or tire flats or who knows what maybe even a structure failure. still great game so far just these are my personal thought and questions. map size. the map is good but its kind of small. will the map size be bigger in the official release. and my final thought and question. welding. you can only have one bearing on something instead of 2 or in some odd case 3 bearings on one peice of building. is it possible to include a welding option in the official release? these are my personal thoughts and questions i had to ask. and like i said the game is AMAZING to be in a early release and i cant wait to see what else you have for it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You'd be suprised what this game has to offer! I bought this game with high expectations and I am very pleased with it so far. Stunning mechanics and physics, easy building system as well as a good explained tutorial when you first spawn into the game to get you started, and this is something I like, because in very many other games you're forced to spend hours figuring out the real" basics out on your own. With that being said the list just goes on forever with what you can create in this game. The only thing that holds you back is your own mind and imagination.

The game (at its current stage is in beta) also has the Multiplayer mode available as well. Its very simple and with a press on alt+tab you can invite your friends directly to your private little world. It is worth mentioning that you might experience lag from the current server system but I wouldn't doubt that this is something the developers are already working more on.

Pros/Cons
+ Beautiful game
+ VERY Affordable Price
+ Easy to learn
+ Genious multiplayer system
+ Amazing mechanics

- Servers will need to get better"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After about 10 hours of game play some solo and some multi player I figured I would write a brief review.

First off, this is a building type game with physic and gravity. If this type of game does not appeal to you or you are looking for a game with a hardcore pvp element this is not a game for you. (Save your money)

That said, if you like building type games that pose a challange, creativity and the freedom to experiment through trial and error then this is definetly the type of game for you. I was hoping the game would be everything it has turned out to be and it is still very early in its developement. I would recommend checking Youtube there are tons of videos that showcase all kinds of examples that will pretty much confirm whether or not this game is your thing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There are some big problems right now, but let me be the first to say that this game is addicting, and has a lot of player freedom. Here are the problems:

- There is no save, or quicksave option. This results in hours of work being lost because of the game crashing. Game crashes happen semi frequently.
- You cannot save a model you have built. This would be a cool feature.
- Multiplayer is extremely laggy and glitches fairly often.

This game has tons of promise however.  A quick resolve to the above issues would tremendously enhance the game. I would recommend it, but if you're waiting to buy, perhaps wait for them to fix some bugs, and buy it. Worth the $20 bugs and lag aside.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Scrap Mechanic is exactly the sort of game where just you think you've seen it all, then someone comes out with this incredible new device powered by friction with ducks.

The machines you can build in this game are limitless, and with a little imagination you can get hundreds of hours out of this game. Once you start connecting bearings and configuring controllers, you'll find you can easily slip into the rhythm of things, and before you know it you'll be buiding walking robots and transforming houses. It's the perfect balance of simple and technical, sensible and hilarious. Which brings me to my next point.

Multiplayer in Scrap Mechanic is laggy and buggy, but enormously fun. You'll quickly find yourself ramming your car into your friend's half-built motorbike, which will spasm into the air, adopting a variety of whacky positions, before settling back to the ground so you can do it again. Racing is also wildly entertaining, with cars falling over and turning off-course repeatedly if you're not careful. If you buy this game, I highly recommend you get a friend or family member to buy it too.

Overall, Scrap Mechanic is a fabulous game. While it's a little rough around the edges, it's a great experience and an excellent way to learn about moving parts and how to use them to create the machines of your dreams!

10/10 Would watch my friend's bike spasm again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With Scrap Mechanic the limits are endless! Will you become the king of the sky and fly over plains, hills, factories, and much, much, more? Or maybe become the first Scrap Mechanic to reach space on your very own space craft? Or maybe even rule the huge land Scrap Mechanic has to offer and speed through forests, up huge mountains, down cliffs, and much more! Most Mechanics choose to use Scrap Mechanic for one use, to build, build, build vehicles. But uniquely, some use their knowledge and experience of making vehicles to build towns, cities, buildings and more. Some of the basic mechanics Scrap Mechanic has is Pilot, Astronaut, and Driver. But there are plently more types you are yet to discover.
List of some Mechanics: 1. Pilot 2. Astronaut 3. Driver 4. Builder 5. Racer 6. Miner and much much more!
Join now =D! P.S. I am on a mac a lot and my friends are always on Scrap Mechanic but unfortantely I can't play since Macs can't play Sm D: can someone fix this please

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR: If you're debating buying this, just buy it. Most of the cons I put are not even problems with the game, just personal opinions. It is a very smooth Early Access Game.

Usually I'm not too serious with reviews, but man...this game. Let's start out with the Pros:

PROS

-Creativity. If you can think it, you can get it to work.

-Incredibly easy to get ahold of. Vehicle building might take awhile to master, but it's a really cool concept.

-Great multiplayer. The best part is if your friend is riding a vehicle, you click on them while holding the Lift item and put the Lift down. Have fun ;)

-Lots of content, especially for an Early Access Game.

-Multiple Block Placement: Remember playing Minecraft and you had to build a huge wall? Placing each individual block was a pain. But now you can place several blocks at a time. There is a limit, but it is much nicer.

CONS

-A little glitchy in Multiplayer. Now I was playing with my buddy and he was hosting a server while in a hotel room, so that might be why.

- You can only connect one switch to one bearing at a time. If you were making a door, it really can only be one way. This is a little bit annoying as you'd have to make multiple entrances, so hopefully it will be fixed. But maybe that's just part of the game, I don't know.

- This is just a personal annoyance: you can't fly in creative mode. Sure, you can make something that flies, but it would sure help with building if your character could fly. I was trying to make a monorail system and I just gave up because I had to go on the rail and build backwards. But if this isn't something they want to add, I understand completely.

- No modes other than creative as of right now. However, it was comfirmed that they are going to add a Survival aspect so I look forward to that.

These cons aren't all that bad though. Seriously, if you're debating to buy Scrap Mechanic or not, just buy it. It is such a fun game and even though it might take a little time to master, it'll be worth it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game definately has potential, but it is kind of annoying as it sits. The devs were super hyped for a long time about adding glass blocks, but there still is no way to connect more than two buttons to a controller. So when I build a house, I can look out my nice see through windows, but I have to dedicate an entire floor of my building to housing the 13 controllers I need to open all my doors. They also added a driver's seat that could fit in a 3 block wide vehicle, for symmetry purposes. They failed to remedy the engine that is still 2x2. So I can have a nice 1 block wide vehicle, but my engine is stuck hanging out on one side or the other. They need to focus on the bigger picture and make common sense decisions. I've already played more than two hours, so my chance of getting a refund is small. I guess I'll play the game in a month or two and see what has improved. This game would be way better with friends, but I wouldn't honestly convince them to buy this game *as it sits*. Hopefully it's better in a while, but right now, I'd suggest you look at Homebrew or SimplePlanes instead.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A lot of fun.  This is where I hoped Minecraft would go.  Minecraft is digital primitive Lego.   Scrap Mechanic is Lego Mindstorms.

I had a blast with the first bit of time I have spent with it.  I was able to get it to run on my surface pro 3.  Doesn't look pretty, but it makes up for it with fun. I built s very simple goofy car at lunch and was cracking up driving it around.  I had no issues getting it to work and am looking forward to playing on my main rig at home.  There is a lot of potential with this game and I can only see it getting bigger and better as time goes on.  One of the better early access titles on day one.

Graphics - are good (basing it off surface Intel hd abilities)
Fun - lots there and to be had
Mechanics and game play - Simple to figure out and easy to use. It will allow you to do some pretty cool stuff if you are willing to put some effort into it.  Imagination is the only limit here.

Totally worth the 20$

Looking forward to the updates. Excellent work Dev's

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is from the day of EA release after ~2h of gameplay and after building an awesome-super-pretty-badass car, that I named Douglas. Duggy is my favourite and I love him.

So far I'm having a blast with the game and I would recommend it to everyone who enjoys creative games and outside-the-box thinking. The controls/mechanics are very intuitive and 'make sense', at least that's how I would describe it. There is so much awesome potential here, I can't wait for possible mods/workshop implementation. Since I have no friends who play this game, I can't say much for Multiplayer yet, but I bet it's even more fun than SP.
Now, if you are a player who only enjoys games where you have 'stuff to do', like quests/objectives/survival or are one of those 'arrghh kill11l evry1!!! pew pew pew! types
date: you probably won't enjoy it. The former
recommended: because so far only creative has been implemented and the latter
hoursPlayed: well that's kinda obvious.\nThe price does seem a bit steep for an early access title
voteText: but I for one know already that I will get my 20 bucks worth of gameplay out of it even if it doesn't develop any further (worst scenario). If it's too expensive for you
helpfulPercent: just wait until it's on sale or till it's developed further to buy. Because if you really enjoy gameplay like that this game is for you.\nA few technical things:\nIt runs  okay on my mid-range laptop (30-35 fps low settings) and it still looks good
votesHelpful: too. The only bug I encountered so far is the crash on exit but nothing else. I didn't try MP yet
votesTotal: so can't say if there are any problems there but SP is fine."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has an awesome direction. I cannot wait to see what the future has in store for Scrap Mechanic.

Early Alpha Review:
The physics are simply fun. The building mechanic is unique to say the least. I had great fun just building simple trucks and giant cars. I can see this game becoming something big with a few updates to the survival aspect of the game (which is not here yet). The only mode in this state of the game is creative. I have not gotten a chance to experience multiplayer yet, but I could only imagen the fun I could have with some buddies in this game. Overall I would recommend this alpha due to the uniqueness of the building mechanics. People are going to be making some crazy things in this game and I can't wait to see it!

If you like building weird things and messing around for hours on end, you would enjoy this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good! I bought the game within minutes of it coming out, and I have to say I am very impressed! Very well set up controls and hub. No trouble for me so far. I get a good 90 FPS steady on maxed settings and my computer isn't anything to look at.

All in all my summary is.

Gameplay 9/10

Graphics 10/10 I love the game style.

Physics 6/10 It's still a little buggy. thinks like poles will sometimes stand up even if they are unbalanced and sideways.

Optimisation 7/10 My friend gets unsteady frames when we play together. Maybe better server support?

So yeah. I would 10/10 recommend this game to other people.

Also I believe they will have a survival mode soon, so I am looking forwards to that, and will update my review when it does!

I made two bog rolls become a paper towel roll.
10/10 best game eu/au/nu/wewew

but in all seriousness this is a amazing game. great mechanics that are simple to use but difficult to master (which i love btw)
a little bug which even though may be a bug i dont want them to fix is that if the parts for a vehicle are lower then the jack. it can stick into the ground. which actually helped me keep my things in place so they wouldn't fly/drive off.

multiplayer works great through the P2P system AND TO GET THAT RIGHT IS A ♥♥♥♥ING AWARD IN ITSELF.
what id like as a aditional part is a keybind system that when your in a seat you can use certain binds to active things like attached switches. i say this because i made a car that has fold out thruster/boosters but i was only able to use them by either flipping a switch then getting in the car or by making the car go forward connecting it to the controller

all in all a great well made game that even on the point of realease i had no troubles with this game.

recommend to anyone who loves rudigoldberg machines or besige

Early Access Review

Great game. A few issues as you'd expect from an early-access game and some of the mechanics can also be a bit frustrating at times.

However none of this takes away the hours of fun I can waste creating machines that whizz through the sky before crashing into a tree, or trying to figure out how to build a jet powered door that doesn't land on your head as you walk through.

Looking forward to seeing how it develops. Thoroughly recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is great. One of the best early access experiences i've had so far. Super fun to play, way deeper than i thought it would be for just having launched as early access, and absolutely hilarious to play with friends.

Obviously, being early access, there are plenty of little bugs. I've yet to encounter anything gamebreaking or too wonky so far. The basic mechanics of the game seem to work great, the game runs well and looks pretty good. I think one of the most hilarious things to do is what my friend dubbed sending ♥♥♥♥ into orbit". Strap a bunch of thrusters onto something and just let it go. I don't really know why it's so funny but it has yet to get old."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is actually my first review, but I feel like this game definitely warrants one. While the price tag is a little hefty, the gameplay is well worth it (assuming your computer can handle it). This game is a Minecraft meets Beseige open world creative game that is just in it's birth. I've logged only a few hours and have already made a secret hidden lab similar to Breaking Bad that transforms into a quaint house. And did I mention the whole thing can drive away? But here's what I like and didn't like about the game.

Pros:
Scrolling placement with blocks (not one by one like Minecraft)
Custom vehicles that work regardless of skill or engineering knowledge
Beautifully laid out handbook to help you in any aspect of the game
Beautiful graphics for being cartoon-esque
Plenty of item for such a new game
Infinite possibilities. Your imagination is your only limitation
Hints at what is going to be coming in future updates like farming
Almost feels like a puzzle game at times but really rewarding when contraptions work

Cons:
Controls are a little finicky at times, just experiment with sensitivity and find a comfortable setting
Mistakes are costly. Very little forgiveness with deleting and replacing parts. Whole limbs of vehicles fall off and can't be reassembled.
Controls sometimes feel like you're driving a boat.
Creative mode needs a fly feature

Overall, I 100% recommend this game if you like Minecraft or Beseige. This is a happy medium with less destruction. The game is not 100% complete yet, but there is obvious attention to future updates. The base game right now if still incredibly fun. Make sure your computer can handle it, then click the buy button because you won't regret it.

Hopefully this helps!
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is actually my first review, but I feel like this game definitely warrants one. While the price tag is a little hefty, the gameplay is well worth it (assuming your computer can handle it). This game is a Minecraft meets Beseige open world creative game that is just in it's birth. I've logged only a few hours and have already made a secret hidden lab similar to Breaking Bad that transforms into a quaint house. And did I mention the whole thing can drive away? But here's what I like and didn't like about the game.

Pros:
Scrolling placement with blocks (not one by one like Minecraft)
Custom vehicles that work regardless of skill or engineering knowledge
Beautifully laid out handbook to help you in any aspect of the game
Beautiful graphics for being cartoon-esque
Plenty of item for such a new game
Infinite possibilities. Your imagination is your only limitation
Hints at what is going to be coming in future updates like farming
Almost feels like a puzzle game at times but really rewarding when contraptions work

Cons:
Controls are a little finicky at times, just experiment with sensitivity and find a comfortable setting
Mistakes are costly. Very little forgiveness with deleting and replacing parts. Whole limbs of vehicles fall off and can't be reassembled.
Controls sometimes feel like you're driving a boat.
Creative mode needs a fly feature

Overall, I 100% recommend this game if you like Minecraft or Beseige. This is a happy medium with less destruction. The game is not 100% complete yet, but there is obvious attention to future updates. The base game right now if still incredibly fun. Make sure your computer can handle it, then click the buy button because you won't regret it.

Hopefully this helps!

Steam asks: Do you recommend this game?" and I answer: Y-E-S. YES!

The best comparison I can make for this game is that it's  Skyrim with guns. a more complex Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts and Bolts mixed with a more simplified
date: yet still as complex Minecraft redstone-like system.\n\nMy friend and I have been looking for a game to fill the void that (the surprisingly good) Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts and Bolts left after selling our Xbox 360s. We have waited years for a game to come out that gets it right - Robocraft and other games were good but not the kind of good we were looking for. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Originally I disliked this game becuase i was unable to get the game to work but after some help and digging around i was able to get it to work so lets have a better review besides just a complant.

Pros
1.The game looks very good, Its cartoony graphics work very well with the gameplay
2.The building mechanic is very easy to use and allows almost complete freedom of creativity(Almost)
3. The game is honestly just fun, easly spend hours building stuff.
4. The support by the community is amazing
5. The game is going to keep getting better so the game will improve over time.

Cons

Every good game has stuff that isnt great.

1.The game isnt well optimized, it will crash and have problems until more updates come out.
2.The game sort of has a building limit due to there not being opitimization with must systems. If you build to much the game will lag and then crash.
3.Right now the game doesnt have alot of content, which is a bummer.


To end off this game is sort of expensive for what it offers at the time of this review. It is sort of a tech demo that cost 20 dollars. Dont let that scare you, this game is great. The game is fun and you will spend alot of time playing it. It is a game that will become very popular. Honestly if you like building stuff, you will fall in love with this game.

Sorry for poor spelling, I'm to lazy to spell check this review.

The game itself is really enjoyable and it has a lot of potential to be a great game, but it will take time. As of right now the game has quite a few major/minor bugs, but that is the price to pay when you buy an early access game. I reccomend getting this game if you're into building, and engineering in games.

Cons

- Occasionally crashes when exiting a world, or randomly during play.

- Game crashes usually after building 3-5 vehicles.
(not a problem on my end, I have confirmed this.)

- If you hit the ground too hard with your wheels they
will get stuck in the ground and you'll have to replace game now I
your car.

- Map is pretty small atm, made a rocket but it couldn't
go very far due to the world border.

- Not enough to do right now, I think this game is
promising so I'll give it time.

Pros

- Really ♥♥♥♥in fun if you play with a friend

- Rewarding when you make something that works well.

- Very promising game, if you don't like the game now I suggest checking it out in the future.

- You can build a mufukin ATAT.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played for 10 hours so far.. I like it but then I would because I like sandboxes and physics.

There are not a whole lot of block types yet. Hopefully they come up with a block that can be whatever color you choose. The bearing parts and how they function are pure genius, good job.
There are a lot of places that this game could go if the devs put the effort in!!

I wish there was a timer part that could control switches on / off functions based on time.
What about an accelerometer that could turn switches on / off based on angle?
Or how about some aerodynamic simulation..  like rudders and wings and propellers?
What about a remote control seat so you can pilot something from another place?

I would like to see some more complicated physics parts too.  A physics part that can make blocks slide in the track of another part  (for example the lift on a fork lift).  Also, maybe a few different sized pulleys and a cable that can go with it.
What about naming a collection of parts, like car" for example. Then a tool that can teleport you to that object and a tool that could delete an object in its entirety.


The suspensions cant really be complex. it cannot be connected at an angle (example:  to make something like a halo warthog)

Overall
date: I would say that it is a great little sandbox to goof around in and I really hope the devs continue to improve on this.. cannot wait to see what they have in mind for this game.\n"

One drawback is if you accidently delete your drivers seat your creation will fly off into the sunset only to be seen but never touched again. You can build in 2 worlds, one is flat and empty I suggest using this one. The other is full of hills and trees which basicaly stop you driving or flying about. I built a big fold up flying castle , with stairs, toilets and walls all appearing as if from nowhere only for my first flight lasting 10 seconds into a fatal dissaster........ reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Was very reluctant to buy this game but after watching several Youtube videos and streams decided to take the plunge. Overall it is a lot of fun especially if you like to tinker. Ive designed numerous scratch build aircraft in real life and thought this might make for a FUN Winter project to kill some time. Im not a big FPS guy or GTA player so this game was right up my alley. Here's my thoughts:

PROS-
1) Graphics are great.
2) Concept is amazing.
3) Flow of the game is very good.

OBSERVATIONS-
1) Limited focus on flying aircraft. I.e. No way to adjust the amount of THRUST on the jet style engines.
2) Airfoils-aerodynamics etc. are non exhistent.
3) The maps are all or nothing. Either FULL of terrain or flat. No happy medium.
4) FPS are terrible and laggy at times.
5) Scarp/Items are limited at this time. Id like to see some smaller more useful items. I get the concept but making a prop" out of a metal beam is difficult.
6) The ability to "center". Most objects in my aircraft such as Tail fins
date: etc. are always off center because of how the objects line up.\n\nI understand this game is still in the making but feel it has SO MUCH potential.....its a STAY TUNED game for sure."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not that great. To sum up the game - garry's mod without glitchy physics, but limited options. It is early access, but if certain things are not added, it will not be worth the money.

What's wrong with it:

You can't fly in creative mode. This makes building large things very difficult.

Currently it's a car/plane building game. Not allot you can do with it. I will explain:

To make a car, you build the body. Put a driver's seat on it, put an engine on it, put bearings" on the sides
date: (which can spin with control) then put wheels over the bearings. You put a bearing horizontal for the wheels to turn.\n\nIf a bearing is horizontal
recommended:
the engine cannot power it. you can only control horizontal bearings with "a" and "d".

You can see how the game is pointing towards only car building.

This is all I have to say. I only played an hour
hoursPlayed: but that's enough to notice certain flaws. I believe the video said "build anything" that is not true. The possibilities are very limited from the simple fact that you can't power a horizontal bearing.\n\nIf you just want to build cars and planes
voteText: then the game is great. (not sure about planes) But it's definetly not a "build anything" type of game."
