reviewText:
Early Access Review

Review of Beta version 0.1.11, things may have changed since review date:

This game has a ton of potential behind it. Once there are some survival/difficulty methods added into the game I can find myself playing more than I do now, which is just to get the basics down. It would also be neat as well as if there will be digging and voxel terrain (making digging/logging machines would be really neat to gain materials). The sky is the limit, really for this game.

I also don't think I've had a game where I've had fun making contraptions like this since Lego Creator back on Windows 98. Think Besiege but sandbox worlds rather than levels. It's intuitive, yet super simple. All it needs now is explosions to be like Lego Creator! xD

There are a couple of things so far that need fixing, such as adding pre-built parts onto other machines, a way to clear clutter from the ground, as well as throttles compared to toggle and hold button options. Pulley systems would be nice. Customized key presses would also be great for buttons you place on a controlled vehicle. I'm sure things like these will be added in time, though.

Definitely worth the investment at $20 I would say. Would recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I personally love this game, and by looking at other reviews I think everyone who has this game agrees. For a game in early accsess its incredible! I am going to write some pros and cons.

Pros:
-The possibilities are endless for ur imagination!
- Its easy to understand
- The art style/appearence is great, really suits the game
- This may sound simple but both gender characters
- The handbook is helpful and handy for beggingers
- The extra Man made stuctures spread through out the map is great

now for the Cons:

- The map isnt too big, and isnt too good for exploring, within a few mins of exploring u know almost the whole map
- there can be a lot lag if u make too many creations, ik its hard to fix that but pls try

Other than those 2 cons, I love the game! This game has a lot of potential and cant wait to see the survival mode getting added and the game develop over time! I defintly recommend thsi game for any1 who is either creative, loves a challenge or wants fun, or all 3 of those things!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!THIS IS A GREAT GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!

I bought this game for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles, it turned out to be one of the best purchases i couldve made. Its got Decent physics and great mechanics. Of course its still early access and im sure theres tons more to come, but i have had a blast with just whats available on this game. More than i can say for almost all of the other early access games ive played on steam.

Pros:
great mechanics
good Physics
endless building possibilities
Price

Cons:
no objectives
no lobbies to connect to other players
Not a ton of mechanical tools (im sure theyre working on making more goodies.)
Creative mode only (for now)

what id like to see out of this game:

Objectives
PvP (although i dont want it solely focused on PvP)
survival mode
More mechanics





If the devs take this in the right direction i dont see why this wouldnt be a massive success.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you've ever played Little Big Planet or even Besiege, and you enjoy making intricate contraptions and enjoy just sitting down and figuring out how to make something work.. Then I think you will LOVE this game. Even in the current state there is plenty to tinker with and it can be very in depth.

Hopefully with time the devs can continue to build on this game and improve it and add more features like pistons, configureable controls, and more gate control. And for an early access game, it runs pretty well and I've run into very few glitches and bugs.

All in all, for me its worth the $20

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally fun game. Only came out 4 days ago as of when this review was written. (Which is already possible) Literally whatever you can imagine. Also, for the people who might look at that as a minecraft clone, its not. The Mechanics are completly different. The only thing simular is the use of Voxel. So take what I say if you will and TRY THIS GAME. Be prepared for a small learning curve but besides that you can jump in really quick to the world of Scrap Mechanic!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*************2 hour review:*************
Brief summary:
So far, this feels very very much like an early Banjo and Kazooie: Nuts and Bolts remaster. I'm enjoying it a lot, and although it may be early, it is still very fun and even though there are few items to mess around with, you can still build things beyond belief with the right imagination. There are a few downsides, as it is in early access, which means you only get creative mode, and a lot of the main parts of the game to be are missing, such as the functionality of fuel tanks, pipes, wires, and the entire farming aspect has been yet to be put in.

-Gameplay:
It is overall a very fun game to play. There are a decent number of things to build with, including stuff like steel beams, wood blocks, metal blocks, concrete blocks, and etc. The ideas around the whole building process are very simple, as you place things down called bearings" on top of blocks and place a block on top of that in order to get a joint. You can create large systems of things through using buttons and switches that connect up to these bearings
date: including a very fine angle tuning to how far you want the bearings to go to. Of course
recommended: main parts of the gameplay are indeed missing
hoursPlayed: but the basic frame has been put down to build off of
voteText: and I believe if they stick to this
helpfulPercent:
it should be very promising.

-Multiplayer:
I have noticed that the game can be a bit jittery as of now in terms of lag in multiplayer
votesHelpful: but that's to be assumed while the game's devs work out the net coding. Learning how to build things together seems to be a good option and can provide hours of fun while trying to figure things out. Fun overall
votesTotal:
but trying to do complicated things with only a decent internet cannot provide much of an experience.

-Updates:
In the short time this game has been out
votesFunny: I have noticed many small updates to fix bugs in high frequency
commentsCount:
so I am very satisfied as of the date of this review. The devs seem to be very dedicated to making sure the bugs get squashed out right now.

-Bugs and Crashes:
Again
column16: to be expected with an early access game
column17: but it does indeed have many bugs as of now. I've crashed twice so far and within a two hour span
column18: had my friend crash around 3-4 times. Normal gameplay seems to be working fine
column20: if you try to do other things such as leave to the menu or create a new game
column21:
I've noticed random crashes here and there. I'll try to indicate if any of these updates iron out these issues.

-Graphics:
The graphics are very good for a new game
column23: they can definitely be taxing on even a decent machine. I cannot run some of the highest settings with my GTX 760 4GB without getting around 20-30 fps at best. When I did try all the highest settings
column24: it did look very pretty though. There's was a lot of detail that made the landscape look very lush.\n\nOverall
column25: I'd rate this 6.5/10 for an early access game as of now with hope for the potential it has (as of 1/24/2016). Fully finished and I would definitely give it a score of at least 8.5/10. It is definitely recommended to have friends who you can mess around with in the game who have a decent internet connection in order to get the full fun factor."

Surprisingly polished and enough building features to keep you busy experimenting.

It's early access, there are bugs. I personally haven't encountered any serious bugs, but i'm sure the negatives reviews here are completely valid.
Bugs aside, the game is fun. There's only a creative mode, and there are no objectives, but you have many tools at your exposal that all work well to be creative and build some interesting contraptions.

If you don't mind the bugs and you don't mind that there are no objectives, then i do recommend it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMy experience with the game so far has been mostly positive. The game runs great and looks good as well. I expected there to be many bugs but it is surprisingly stable at this early stage. You can get into building cool stuff pretty quickly with an intuitive building system and a very handy guide. In its current state (day after release) there are over a hundred parts to play with. There is a lack of mechanical parts however with only the bearing that allows movement. Even with this shortcoming there are loads of building possibilities and if the developers stick to their promise a lot of parts should be added. I am pleased to say the game is in a healthy state and I am excited to see where it will go especially with the survival mode in development. I put my trust in the developers and if you do too go buy the game as there is already a lot of fun to be had as is. If you are looking for more than a sandbox it’s best to wait for the survival mode release.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is way better than what I was expecting. Runs extremely good, really nice graphics and no bugs found yet. reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is truly amazing! It has all the key elements to build magnificent vehicles and mechanisms. You may say to your self: Why isnt there a piston-like thing that can push objects of make an elevator?" Well
date: just by thinking smart and complex you will figure it out. It can be VERY complex and technical and it is sooo rewarding to see the result after you have built it. The game has the fundamental to build whatever you want if you just have the creativity and intelligence. aaaaand it has online which is awesome.\n\nWith that said
recommended: there are some things I would like to see added in furture patches and some performance issues and other stuff. About the performance
hoursPlayed: the game doesnt run at 60fps on my AMD R9 290X on a empty world. and my friends that have NVIDIA does. BUT something that happends with both cards is that when the map starts to fill up with a lot of creations with a lot of things connected to it at once
voteText: it starts to lag dramaticly... we are talking down to 10fps reguardless of video card. That is because it is too many entities that is active at once. So that is a optimalization problem that Axolot Games have to figure out!\n\nAbout the online part: It is sooo fun to play with friends
helpfulPercent: but what is a bummer is that only the host has the save. So if you make a creation on a friends save
votesHelpful: you can only access it when he starts the save from his local computer. You can always send your save files to your freinds tho. Also
votesTotal: having 4 people building at the same time.... it doesnt take long before the FPS closes to 10-15fps.\n\nMy overall experience with the game is a 9/10
votesFunny: it is just up my alley. I just hope that Axelot Games fixes some of the performance issues for AMD. and im looking forward to seeing new content in the furture!\n\nGREAT GAME

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Review of Beta version 0.1.11, things may have changed since review date:

This game has a ton of potential behind it. Once there are some survival/difficulty methods added into the game I can find myself playing more than I do now, which is just to get the basics down. It would also be neat as well as if there will be digging and voxel terrain (making digging/logging machines would be really neat to gain materials). The sky is the limit, really for this game.

I also don't think I've had a game where I've had fun making contraptions like this since Lego Creator back on Windows 98. Think Besiege but sandbox worlds rather than levels. It's intuitive, yet super simple. All it needs now is explosions to be like Lego Creator! xD

There are a couple of things so far that need fixing, such as adding pre-built parts onto other machines, a way to clear clutter from the ground, as well as throttles compared to toggle and hold button options. Pulley systems would be nice. Customized key presses would also be great for buttons you place on a controlled vehicle. I'm sure things like these will be added in time, though.

Definitely worth the investment at $20 I would say. Would recommend.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Was very reluctant to buy this game but after watching several Youtube videos and streams decided to take the plunge. Overall it is a lot of fun especially if you like to tinker. Ive designed numerous scratch build aircraft in real life and thought this might make for a FUN Winter project to kill some time. Im not a big FPS guy or GTA player so this game was right up my alley. Here's my thoughts:

PROS-
1) Graphics are great.
2) Concept is amazing.
3) Flow of the game is very good.

OBSERVATIONS-
1) Limited focus on flying aircraft. I.e. No way to adjust the amount of THRUST on the jet style engines.
2) Airfoils-aerodynamics etc. are non exhistent.
3) The maps are all or nothing. Either FULL of terrain or flat. No happy medium.
4) FPS are terrible and laggy at times.
5) Scarp/Items are limited at this time. Id like to see some smaller more useful items. I get the concept but making a prop" out of a metal beam is difficult.
6) The ability to "center". Most objects in my aircraft such as Tail fins
date: etc. are always off center because of how the objects line up.\n\nI understand this game is still in the making but feel it has SO MUCH potential.....its a STAY TUNED game for sure."

Version 0.1.21

verity of parts to make many creations
graphics are great

wonderful replay value

Cons:
needs more parts (pistons, hydraulics, ropes, curved parts, bigger bearings, glass)
welding tool not out yet (i know its coming)
Water terrain
game optimization with large creations

overall wonderful game and would recommend to anyone with a creative mind. i am excited to see what the developers add and how they advance the game and game play. waiting for survival mode.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I think this is probably my first review and I just wanted to say how much I have enjoyed playing this so far!
If you are fed up of all of the FPS, Survival Sims, and Minecraft-clones that seem to be all there is coming out at the moment then you will love this. Its my sort of game too, being a mechanical engineer I love building games where not much actually happens.
I think the best way to describe this currently is a cross between Kerbal, Garrys Mod and Besiege so it shall hence forth be known as Garry's KSPSiege! Ow and if you loved any of those games (or all of them) then you will love this.
Just sit back relax and build some wacky creations.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, just got this game and I must say for an EA" release I'm pleased. I'll be looking forward to public servers. Here is a recap of what this game is going to get you and if it's worth your dime.

Firstly: *This is based on an Early Access review.

Pros
- Runs Smoothly (780ti SLI and i74770k)
- Parts fit nicely together
- Game HAS TONS of potential.
- Fun SOLO gameplay as well as Co-Op

Cons
- Few Parts *you can get quite creative though
- Small Map
- No Public Servers
- No "Hydraulics" (Can be engineered w/ bearings)

In this games current state you'll get a couple of hours before your fun runs out. You MUST be creative and use logic to build things. Honestly if you aren't creative don't waste your money. You have to find ways to make bearings do all the work. This game has a very bright future ahead of it. I'm glad to have purchased and feel this will be the next KSP.  GJ Axolot!

8/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Would absolutly love to talk to the devs about this amazing game !

I am not beating on this game ! it may sound like it but I am not . love this game !

Ok hello my name is Zulu and I am here to tell you about scrap mechanic from the view of a gear head and life time tinkerer !     I love the possibilitys of this game and in its current state too , but i would love to see a welder tool of some kind. (example) if you attach a rotor to a block then come off of it with a bar, add another rotor and bar until you are able to make a 180 and it aligns back to the original body the block looks like it should be attached but it is not. =( . if i want to build a vehicle that has 1 axel across the front and 2 shocks atached to it with rotors the game wont allow me to attach both shocks to the axel at once. So thats why i would love to see if you have blocks that align ( rotors/blocks\shocks) that you could bring out a tool and connect them . as of right now 2 rotors cannot be connected to one item then back to the original bracket .
It is a simple thing but it would unlock so many directions for this game !

Can't wait to see what direction this game goes in !   And have fun building !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A darn good early access game.

The developer should rename this to Scrapheap Challenge: The Video Game" which it essentially is.You can build pretty much anything you can think of
date: which is amazing considering it's in early access.\n\nThe game only has a creative mode at the moment
recommended: so no objective as such but just grab a couple of friends in multiplayer
hoursPlayed:
split into teams and challenge each team to a Scapheap Challenge. Create the fastest car with no wheels. A vehicle that can climb vertically. A car that can dock with another car at high speed. Or.. Robot wars!

You get it. You can make things.

Side note: The game looks and runs great. It however can become laggy when people build a lot of contraptions with a lot of moving parts."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The first time I played this what really impressed me was the logical construction of machines. The interface really helps you build in a natural way. I was able to build a fairly decent tractor with suspension in minutes a task which would of taken ages in similer games. The lift is an invaluable tool which gives you the flexibility to move and raise youir machines at any time my only wish is that they allow you to remove it with a key press so you  don't have to get off your machine.

Don't hesitate in getting this game I have already built a robot with sensor, tractor, monster truck and rocket  the possibilities are endless and I'm hoping that workshop support will be added soon so we can all share our machines that would be the icing on the cake for me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A darn good early access game.

The developer should rename this to Scrapheap Challenge: The Video Game" which it essentially is.You can build pretty much anything you can think of
date: which is amazing considering it's in early access.\n\nThe game only has a creative mode at the moment
recommended: so no objective as such but just grab a couple of friends in multiplayer
hoursPlayed:
split into teams and challenge each team to a Scapheap Challenge. Create the fastest car with no wheels. A vehicle that can climb vertically. A car that can dock with another car at high speed. Or.. Robot wars!

You get it. You can make things.

Side note: The game looks and runs great. It however can become laggy when people build a lot of contraptions with a lot of moving parts."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The first time I played this what really impressed me was the logical construction of machines. The interface really helps you build in a natural way. I was able to build a fairly decent tractor with suspension in minutes a task which would of taken ages in similer games. The lift is an invaluable tool which gives you the flexibility to move and raise youir machines at any time my only wish is that they allow you to remove it with a key press so you  don't have to get off your machine.

Don't hesitate in getting this game I have already built a robot with sensor, tractor, monster truck and rocket  the possibilities are endless and I'm hoping that workshop support will be added soon so we can all share our machines that would be the icing on the cake for me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best Early Access Game ever!
I'm only 11 hours into playing and I can tell you that this game is worth the buy!

I'm hoping that the Devs keep up the good work on this title and it doesn't fall through the cracks like a lot of early access games. Although the parts and the mechanics of them are few and far betwee, what you can do with them are only limited by your imagination! Purchased a copy for myself and a friend; and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. Still very glitchy from time to time, which is expected, but I'm still having issues with framerate and lag. I'm running a pretty beafy PC and there should be no reason this game shouldn't run at least 60FPS.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, amazing game so far, and even for being out for only over a week at this point, it's very enjoyable! I would really reccomend this for people who like to create their own vehicles and designs in a sandbox-type environment. The gameplay in singleplayer right now is very smooth, with little to no fps issues, though the multiplayer as of now is quite choppy, understandably, and hope this will be improved in the future with upgraded servers and possibly dedicated hosting. I think that Water/aerodynamics in this game (when most of the current content is completed) would be pretty neat to see, and I hope it gets implemented :). I would like to congradulate the devs and wish them luck throughout the finishing of this game!

Edit: I've seen that a lot of people get a crash when starting up the game (this didn't happen to me, on a Windows 7 computer) and it seems to be a problem with Windows 10 (from what I've seen people talking about). Make sure you check around and see if you may have any issues launching the game based on your system specs before getting it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nShaping up to be one of the best builder games ever. No seriously; EVER. I typically hate games like this, but for some reason I forgot to sleep while playing this. TWICE. 6 hours at a time. I've dedicated myself to building a huge mothership. There's not a whole lot of items you can build with, but your imagination drives what you can do with them. And if you've looked this game up, you'll see that there's plenty of crazy things you can do. I don't even care if I'm fragging anything playing this. I'm alone in a cartoon world; Don't care. I'm short, fat and have orange hair. Still don't care. I can BUILD THINGS!!! And so can you, while avoiding sleep. Buy this game. NAOW!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis simple game, has recently grown to be one of my favorites. It allows you do build whatever you want, and if you run into a roadblock, you sometimes have to go back to the drawing board, and redesign something, or invent a new technology, or strategy. One of these challenges for me was heavy vehicles which the suspension could not support, so I invented a way to connect suspension together, which now allows me to build vehicles as big and heavy as I want. I highly recommend this game to ANYONE who likes building things.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros
Hours of fun
Endless possibilities
Devs listen to ideas
Music can be made
They worked hard on this and for early acces its great (scrap mechanic has been in development since 2012 (you can see a comparison on their twitter page)
Make the tiny or make the huge!
Welding Tool is here! so you can make small pistons tank treads and even trains!

Cons
Early acces so bugs and can crash (no data lost from crashes for me anyway)
Some updates aren't as great as they sound (like the glass update the glass is green and transparent and paint doesnt help much)
Sometimes the Devs don't add whats wanted (like wings propellers steam workshop etc)
Very Very Glitchy Suspension sometimes (with my R2D2's the suspension makes it flip and roll around like crazy

All in all it's great though no Survival yet (should be in the next update =D but who knows?) but they've confirmed it's in devolopment so yeah forget CoD get this instead!
